    Description
    AbstractCPConstraint
    Abstract class the most of the constraints should extend.
    CPBoolVar
    Boolean variable, that can be used as a 0-1 IntVar.
    CPBoolVarImpl
     
    CPBoolVarIsEqual
     
    CPConstraint
    Interface implemented by every Constraint
    CPConstraintClosure
     
    CPInsertionVar
    used to represent a node and its possible insertions points an insertion point is defined by an integer i and is supposed to be valid if the node can be inserted after node i invalid insertion points are removed using constraints an InsertionVar can have an empty domain and still be valid.
    CPIntVar
     
    CPIntVarImpl
    Implementation of a variable with a SparseSetDomain.
    CPIntVarViewMul
    A view on a variable of type a*x
    CPIntVarViewOffset
    A view on a variable of type x+o
    CPIntVarViewOpposite
    A view on a variable of type -x
    CPSequenceVar
    decision variable used to represent a sequence of nodes the nodes are split into 3 categories: - scheduled nodes, which are part of the sequence and ordered - possible nodes, which could be part of the sequence - excluded nodes, which cannot be part of the sequence
    CPSequenceVarImpl
    a sequence var, where each node is represented by an integer and each insertion is an InsertionVar all nodes are split into 3 categories: members (in the sequence), possible (could be in the sequence) and excluded (cannot be in the sequence) WARNING: the ids for the begin node and the end node MUST be >= number of nodes considered constraints remove insertions points from the InsertionVars contained within the sequence if an InsertionVar cannot be inserted into the sequence, it is set as excluded
